t: Psalm 71
God’s Help in Old Age
Lord,*spn I seek refuge in you; let*ln me never be disgraced.
In*ln your justice, rescue and deliver me; listen*ln closely to me and save me.
Be*ln a rock of refuge for me, where*ln I can always go. Give*ln the command to save me, for*ln you are my rock and fortress.
Deliver*ln me, my God, from the power of the wicked, from*ln the grasp of the unjust and oppressive.
For*ln you are my hope, Lord God,*s my*ln confidence from my youth.
I*ln have leaned on you from birth; you*ln took me from my mother’s womb. My*ln praise is always about you.
I*ln am like a miraculous sign to many, and*ln you are my strong refuge.
My*ln mouth is full of praise and*ln honor to you all day long.
Don’t*pn discard me in my old age. As*ln my strength fails, do not abandon me.
For*ln my enemies talk about me, and*ln those who spy on me plot together,
saying,*ln “God has abandoned him; chase*ln him and catch him, for*ln there is no one to rescue him.”
God,*ln do not be far from me; my*ln God, hurry to help me.
May*ln my adversaries be disgraced and destroyed; may*ln those who intend to harm me be*ln covered with disgrace and humiliation.
But*ln I will hope continually and*ln will praise you more and more.
My*ln mouth will tell about your righteousness and*ln your salvation all day long, though*ln I cannot sum them up.
I*ln come because of the mighty acts of the Lord God;*s I*ln will proclaim your righteousness, yours alone.
God,*pn you have taught me from my youth, and*ln I still proclaim your wondrous works.
Even*ln while I am old and gray, God,*ln do not abandon me, while*ln I proclaim your power to*ln another generation, your*ln strength to all who are to come.
Your*ln righteousness reaches the heights, God, you*ln who have done great things; God,*ln who is like you?
You*ln caused me to experience many*ln troubles and misfortunes, but*ln you will revive me again. You*ln will bring me up again, even*ln from the depths of the earth.
You*ln will increase my honor and*ln comfort me once again.
Therefore,*ln I will praise you with a harp for*ln your faithfulness, my God; I*ln will sing to you with a lyre, Holy*ln One of Israel.
My*ln lips will shout for joy when*ln I sing praise to you because*ln you have redeemed me.
Therefore,*ln my tongue will proclaim your*ln righteousness all day long, for*ln those who intend to harm me will*ln be disgraced and confounded.
